news.title: Meta's Reality Labs cuts sparked fears of a 'VR winter'
news.summary: Meta's deprioritizing virtual reality in favor of artificial intelligence and Internet-connected smart glasses raised concerns about the future of the industry.

news.title: I spent the week with tech CEOs. Here's what they're talking about
news.summary: Four themes were top of mind for tech executives at Davos, and they were all about AI. The themes were: AI, augmented reality, virtual reality and augmented reality.

news.title: Investors went to Davos for AI. They left talking about Greenland
news.summary: Two Davos's emerged: one chasing AI’s future, the other gripped by Greenland, tariffs and the geopolitical risks reshaping investor playbooks.

news.title: Airlines cancel nearly 4,000 weekend flights as massive winter storm sweeps across U.S.
news.summary: U.S. airlines canceled flights and waived change fees for travelers as a cold snap and massive winter storm were forecast to sweep across the country.

news.title: Musk’s $1 trillion pay package renews focus on soaring CEO compensation
news.summary: Elon Musk's stock-fueled gains highlight the booming compensation and wealth gains of CEOs in recent decades. Musk's gains are the latest in a long line of CEOs who have made huge gains in recent years.

news.title: My husband’s kids didn’t even show up for his heart surgery. So why is he leaving them his $1 million life insurance?
news.summary: "Both of us were widowed. We are in our late 60s and retired," she says. "We are both in our 60s, and we are very happy"

news.title: When college athletes go to the NFL, some of them are taking pay cuts in the millions
news.summary: Oregon’s Dante Moore is stiff-arming the NFL to keep playing college football next season. Moore will still make millions of dollars.

news.title: These 4 charts capture the whirlwind action in global markets so far this year
news.summary: Investors are facing tumult in Japan’s bond market, a big rally in small-cap stocks, and surging prices for natural gas, gold and silver.

news.title: I need to spend $15K on my roof. Should I take it from my Roth IRA, 401(k), IRA or money-market account?
news.summary: “I’m 61 years old, single and still have a job,” he says. “I don’t know how I did it. I’ve never been able to do it.”

news.title: I’m inheriting $250K. Will paying off my student loans and credit-card debt hurt my credit score?
news.summary: “The money is coming from the proceeds of the sale of a family home,” he says. “The funds are coming from people who want to give back to the community.”
